description:
I love the simplicty and when it works it works great. But that's the problem... I OFTEN get random characters out of place. I have to input it 3 times before it works correctly. 

I really want this to work and I have to have a text expander, but I just wish it was less buggy.
I use it on windows and ubuntu. I'd writen a review on my blog here https://bradydonald.github.io/posts/espanso/
summary: This is a really good utility

description:
Works like a charm here. 
Can't recommend more.

If this could be made into an app that cpould be launched without the Terminal needed for every command needed to make, I would redownload it - but until it is made similar to AutoKey, I'm afraid I can't becasue the Terminal commands are simply way pver my head!
summary: Too complicated for a simple Linux user

description:
Works really great - you just need to read the get started manual
https://espanso.org/docs/get-started/

The only problem was installation since its based on snap and not apt it will not install the needed dependacies and I had to install them manually.
Again can be found in the how to insall page:
https://espanso.org/install/linux/
I used espanso Ubuntu 20, but it does not start on Ubuntu 22. This is a known bug that is widely reported, but has yet to be corrected. Will be moving on to another utility.
Known issue on GitHub and the dev said he has no time to fix it for the moment :(
No advanced features used, only expansion. The most complex is expansion of current time and date. I am happy with the tool.
summary: I use pure expansions and I am happy as it works

description: Ich habe auf dem Mac damals Textexpander genutzt, danach Atext auf dem Mac und nach meinem Umstieg zu Linux (ein toller Entschluss) habe ich espanso gefunden. Was soll ich sagen: es ist super, funktioniert 100%, kann auch mit unzähligen Snippets umgehen.
